page.title: 04LOWER SWANNATON FARM.
page.content: The 46 acres of cultivated grass is mainly for dairy farming .They have 30 cows(29 Friesian,1 S.Devon),22 sheep 13 pigs,ducks,hens and 2 dogs.The lady also does bed & breakfast,she works from 6.30a.m.to 9.00p.m.every day.Her favourite job is milking the cows,they all have names,e.g.Floss,Delilah,Jenny Penny,Sea-Urchin and Bertha.She sells the milk to Unigate,the lorry comes at about 9.00a.m.The fields also have names,e.g.Barnfield,Smokey Hill,Weeke and Coombes.There is an old quarry in one field,and oak,ash and sycamore woods down near Rock Cottage.They use a Simplex milking machine,a Massey Ferguson dung spreader and a hay turner and an International 51 baler.The wife has farmed here for 40 years,her grandparents moved here from Kingswear in 1902.Her garden is full of fruit,vegetables and flowers.
